--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2021/0568 b) Date of Occurrence: 18/06/2024
c) Installation Details: Stormbird Attack - AC-5758-795 at
Forward Operating Base-1
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 24/06/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Exhaust System d) Main Assembly: Nose Section
e) Nomenclature: Exhaust System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-A
g) Part No.: PR-5563-K9 h) Sl No.: SN-2871-628
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 08/10/2020 l) Date of Removal: 22/06/2024
Pg No: 30 Ln No: 1 Pg No: 146 Ln No: 28
m) Manufacturing Agency: Tactical Systems Manufacturing n) Date, Month & Year April 2018
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 748 Hrs / 1923 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Fuel nozzle blockage. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Component fatigue due to operational stress cycles exceeding design limits
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Exhaust System component. Inspection
revealed damage to critical components.
c) Remedial Measures Implement enhanced testing protocol before component installation
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Modify design to incorporate additional safety margin
d) Attributable Code: N1 - Defect confirmed but reason not established
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 20/07/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Air Cmde S.B. Rao

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 22/07/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection.
Date: 22/07/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid.
Date: 26/07/2024 Signature: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Certification review completed. Proposed modifications do not affect type design approval. Acceptable.
Date: 29/07/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
